meanings.def: a house, especially a large or impressive one
examples: a desirable family residence for sale (= for example, in an advertisement)
10 Downing Street is the British Prime Minister’s official residence.
Tax breaks are often available to those buying a primary residence.
Versailles was the principal residence of the kings of France until 1793.
This desirable family residence is situated in the heart of the town.

meanings.def: the state of living in a particular place
examples: They were not able to take up residence in their new home until the spring.
Please state your occupation and place of residence.
in residence The flag flies when the Queen is in residence.
The family house was sold off but she remained in residence on the ground floor.
The family took up temporary residence in the manor house.
The notice was addressed to her last known place of residence.

meanings.def: permission to live in a country that is not your own
examples: They have been denied residence in this country.

meanings.def: having an official position in a particular place such as a college or university
examples: creative writing classes given by the writer in residence

idioms.def: having an official position in a particular place such as a college or university
examples: creative writing classes given by the writer in residence
